biography.value: The monstrous tyrannosaurus known as the King of Feathers is the undisputed lord of Omu. Most other dwellers of the Forbidden City live in fear of its thunderous approach and steer well clear of the amphitheater, its lair.

description.value:
The King of Feathers makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d12 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The King of Feathers exhales a swarm of insects (wasps) that forms in a space within 20 feet of it. The swarm acts as an ally of the King of Feathers and takes its turn immediately after it. The swarm disperses after 1 minute. It can’t use the Summon Swarm action while it is grappling a creature with its jaws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

See &Reference[invisible]{Invisible}. It can see &Reference[invisible]{invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. It can innately cast misty step at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability is &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the King of Feathers fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
